FuncDef:
The port discard tagged-packet command enables an interface to discard incoming tagged packets.
The undo port discard tagged-packet command disables an interface from discarding incoming tagged packets. The port discard tagged-packet command enables an interface to discard incoming tagged packets. The undo port discard tagged-packet command disables an interface from discarding incoming tagged packets. By default, an interface does not discard incoming tagged packets.
ParentView: Layer 2 100GE interface view,Layer 2 10GE interface view,Layer 2 200GE interface view,25GE-L2 view,400GE-L2 view,Layer 2 50GE interface view,Layer 2 Eth-Trunk interface view,Layer 2 GE interface view,Interface group view
ExtraInfo: Network hosts send untagged packets. When an interface on a switching device connects to hosts, this interface needs only to process untagged packets. To enable the interface to discard incoming tagged packets, run the port discard tagged-packet command. This command prevents hosts from accessing other switching devices after the interface function is changed without permission.
